org.ink.core.vm.mirror
Interface Mirror

All Superinterfaces:
InkObject, Proxiable, Trait
All Known Subinterfaces:
ClassMirror, CollectionPropertyMirror, EnumTypeMirror, ListPropertyMirror, MapPropertyMirror, PrimitiveAttributeMirror, PropertyMirror, ReferenceMirror, StructClassMirror, TraitMirror, ValuePropertyMirror
All Known Implementing Classes:
ClassMirrorImpl, CollectionPropertyMirrorImpl, EnumTypeMirrorImpl, ListPropertyMirrorImpl, MapPropertyMirrorImpl, MirrorImpl, PrimitiveAttributeMirrorImpl, PropertyMirrorImpl, ReferenceMirrorImpl, StructClassMirrorImpl, TraitMirrorImpl, ValuePropertyMirrorImpl
public interface Mirror
extends Trait

The Mirror interface represents the reflection trait of InkObject. It contains reflection-related methods, such as introspection of properties, classes, meta-classes etc.
A Mirror instance is obtained by calling the Proxiable.reflect() method.

Author:
Lior Schachter

edit

<T extends ObjectEditor> T edit()
Begins a non-transactional edit operation on the target.

Returns:
an ObjectEditor initialized with this Mirror's target.

edit

<T extends ObjectEditor> T edit(boolean transactional)
Begins an edit operation on the target, optionally making that operation transactional. A transactional edit operation makes the changes to an isolated copy of the object, and merges it into the Ink VM only when the transaction is ended. A non-transactional edit operation makes the changes directly to the object in the Ink VM.

Parameters:
transactional - whether the edit operation should be isolated in a transaction.
Returns:
an ObjectEditor initialized with this Mirror's target.

get

java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
Retrieves a value from the target's inner cache. The cache is stored on the target object, and an object placed in the cache is not guaranteed to be there indefinitely.

Parameters:
key - the key whose associated value is to be returned.
Returns:
the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key.

put

void put(java.lang.Object key,
         java.lang.Object data)
Stores a value in the target's inner cache. The cache is stored on the target object, and an object placed in the cache is not guaranteed to be there indefinitely.

Parameters:
key - the key with which the specified value is to be associated.
data - the value to be associated with the specified key.

asTrait

<T extends Trait> T asTrait(byte trait,
                            boolean forceNew)
Cast the target object as a trait, allowing to force the creation and initialization of a new trait object.

Parameters:
trait - an absolute index of the trait.
forceNew - whether a new trait object should be created even if such a trait was already initialized.
Returns:
the target object cast to the required trait.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.
See Also:
Proxiable.asTrait(byte)
